availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: State of Ills Franklin Co April 18 ^1864^
Joel Coleman Inlisted in the united State Servis in 1861 in the 54th Regt Curnel Curum Capt Massey And he dide in 1862 the last day of June
Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 19th day of April A D 1864

CLERK'S CERTIFICATE.--Illinois. Luse & Wilson, Printers and Binders, Lafayette, Ind.THE STATE OF ILLINOIS,
Franklin COUNTY. } SS.

I, C M Clark Clerk of the Franklin County Court, for said County, which is a Court of Record, using a Seal, do hereby certify that Wm J Murphey Esq., whose name is subscribed to the foregoing affidavit, was on the day of the date thereof, and still is an acting Justice of the Peace, within and for the said County of Franklin duly commissioned and qualified to office, and as such full faith and credit are due, and of right ought to be given to all his official acts; as well out of as in Court.
In Testimony Whereof, I C M Clark Clerk of the County Court as aforesaid, have hereunto subscribed my name and affixed the Seal of said Court at my office in Benton on the day of April A. D. 1864
